IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDesc: WE COOK. WE DELIVER. WE TEACH. WE CARE.
IRS990.MissionDesc: WE COOK. WE DELIVER. WE TEACH. WE CARE.
IRS990.Desc: OPEN HAND COMMUNITY NUTRITION PROGRAMS INCLUDE:A. IN 2022, OPEN HAND PROVIDED 1,272,398 HOME-DELIVERED MEALS AND MARKET BASKET GROCERY BAGS TO APPROXIMATELY 4,690 CLIENTS PER OUR CONTRACTS. OUR SERVICE AREA IN GEORGIA INCLUDES BARROW, BEN HILL, BERRIEN, BIBB, BRANTLEY, CANDLER, CHATHAM, CARROLL, CATOOSA, CHEROKEE, CLAYTON, COBB, COWETA, DEKALB, DOUGHERTY, DOUGLAS, FAYETTE, FORSYTH, FULTON, GWINNETT, HALL, HENRY, LUMPKIN, MADISON, MUSCOGEE, NEWTON, OGLETHORPE, PAULDING, POLK, RICHMOND, ROCKDALE, SEMINOLE, SPALDING, TIFT, TURNER, UPSON, WALTON, WASHINGTON, WHITFIELD, AND WORTH COUNTIES.B. THE MEDICALLY TAILORED MEALS PROGRAM PROVIDES FOR ONE, TWO, OR THREE FRESHLY COOKED DELICIOUS, THERAPEUTIC MEALS TO MEET THE DAILY NUTRITION NEEDS OF SOCIALLY AND/OR ECONOMICALLY VULNERABLE INDIVIDUALS WHO ARE DEALING WITH A CRITICAL, CHRONIC, OR TERMINAL DISEASE, MANY OF WHOM ARE UNABLE TO PREPARE OR SHOP FOR HEALTHY FOOD DUE TO PHYSICAL LIMITATIONS. OTHER QUALIFYING INDIVIDUALS MAY INCLUDE DEPENDENT CHILDREN OF OPEN HAND CLIENTS, REGARDLESS OF THEIR HEALTH STATUS. AS A SUPPLEMENT TO THIS MEALS PROGRAM, NUTRITION EDUCATION IS DELIVERED ON A REGULAR BASIS IN GROUP CLINICAL SETTINGS AS WELL AS VIRTUALLY THROUGH OUR TELENUTRITION PLATFORM. MENUS ARE DEVELOPED AND PRODUCTS ARE SELECTED BY OPEN HAND'S RDNS AND INCLUDE THERAPEUTIC AND PREFERENTIAL MENU OPTIONS. EACH OF OPEN HAND'S MENUS ARE NUTRITIONALLY BALANCED WHICH ALLOWS CLIENTS TO CUSTOMIZE THEIR MENU TO THEIR DIETARY PREFERENCES WHILE ADHERING TO THE DIET RECOMMENDATIONS BY THEIR MEDICAL PROFESSIONALS.C. OPEN HAND'S MARKET BASKET PROGRAM PROVIDES A WEEKLY SUPPLY OF BOTH NONPERISHABLE GROCERIES AND FRESH FRUIT AND VEGETABLES TO SOCIALLY AND/OR ECONOMICALLY VULNERABLE CLIENTS WHO ARE WELL ENOUGH TO PREPARE THEIR OWN HEALTHY MEALS WITH NUTRITION GUIDANCE PROVIDED BY OPEN HAND RDNS. THESE GROCERY PRODUCTS PROVIDE THE INGREDIENTS FOR 14 MEALS EACH WEEK AND INCLUDE RECIPES AND NUTRITION EDUCATION SO CLIENTS HAVE THE ABILITY TO CREATE THEIR OWN HEALTHY MEALS.D. IN ADDITION, OPEN HAND PROVIDED APPROXIMATELY 90,314 EMERGENCY NUTRITION SUPPLEMENTS (ENS) IN THE FORM OF EMERGENCY MEALS, SNACKS, AND NUTRITION SUPPLEMENTS, TO SOCIALLY AND/OR ECONOMICALLY VULNERABLE INDIVIDUALS, OFTEN DURING EXTENDED WAITS FOR THEIR HEALTH CARE APPOINTMENTS. THE SUPPLEMENTS HELP TO PROVIDE ADEQUATE NUTRITION TO CLIENTS WHO MAY BE EXPERIENCING WEIGHT LOSS OR CHEWING/SWALLOWING CHALLENGES.E. CENTRAL TO OPEN HAND'S COMPREHENSIVE APPROACH TO NUTRITION, CLIENTS ARE ASSESSED THROUGH A CLIENT INTAKE PROCESS AND OFFERED NUTRITION EDUCATION BY OPEN HAND RDNS WHICH INCLUDES EVIDENCE-BASED EDUCATION IN A GROUP SETTING. IN 2022, OPEN HAND ATLANTA BECAME ACCREDITED IN THE DIABETES SELF-MANAGEMENT PROGRAM BY THE ASSOCIATION OF DIABETES CARE AND EDUCATION SPECIALISTS TO PROVIDE DIABETES SELF-MANAGEMENT EDUCATION (DSME) TO CLIENTS FOR WHICH OPEN HAND WAS ABLE TO BILL THE CENTERS FOR MEDICARE & MEDICAID SERVICES (CMS) FOR THESE SERVICES. THUS IN 2022, WE PROVIDED BOTH DSME AND CHRONIC DISEASE SELF-MANAGEMENT WORKSHOPS FOR 35 CLIENTS. THESE PROGRAMS TEACH INDIVIDUALS THE TOOLS NEEDED TO BECOME EFFECTIVE SELF-MANAGERS IN THEIR HEALTHCARE. THEY LEARN TOOLS SUCH AS HEALTHY EATING, PHYSICAL ACTIVITY, HOW TO USE THE MIND, STRESS MANAGEMENT, AND POSITIVE COMMUNICATION TECHNIQUES. THE RDNS ALSO PROVIDE FOOD DEMONSTRATIONS AND NUTRITION SEMINARS FOR A VARIETY OF CLIENT GROUPS ACROSS ATLANTA. F. OPEN HAND PROVIDED MEDICAL NUTRITIONAL THERAPY (MNT) TO 385 CLIENTS IN 2022, THROUGH BOTH IN-PERSON CARE AND OUR VIRTUAL NUTRITION CARE PLATFORM, HEALTHIE. MNT IS PRESCRIBED BY A CLINICIAN TO TARGET SPECIFIC MEDICAL CONDITIONS. SESSIONS INCLUDE A NUTRITION DIAGNOSIS, THERAPY, AND COUNSELING SERVICES - ALL PERFORMED BY OPEN HAND RDNS. DEFINED BY THE ACADEMY OF NUTRITION AND DIETETICS, MNT INCLUDES A SPECIFIC PLAN OF ASSESSMENT, NUTRITION DIAGNOSES, INTERVENTION, EVALUATION/MONITORING, DOCUMENTATION, AND COMMUNICATION WITH CLIENTS' HEALTH CARE PROVIDERS. THIS SERVICE IS AVAILABLE TO INDIVIDUALS WHO HAVE A NUTRITION-SENSITIVE CHRONIC DISEASE TO HELP IMPROVE THEIR HEALTH THROUGH BETTER FOOD CHOICES AND BEHAVIOR MODIFICATION. G. OPEN HAND IS ONE OF GEORGIA'S PARTNERS FOR THE NATIONALLY ACCLAIMED COOKING MATTERS NUTRITION EDUCATION PROGRAM - SIX WEEKS OF CLASSES UTILIZING AN EVIDENCE-BASED CURRICULUM ORIGINALLY DESIGNED BY SHARE OUR STRENGTH. IN 2022, THE OPEN HAND COOKING MATTERS TEAM TAUGHT 638 PARTICIPANTS HOW TO PREPARE HEALTHY, TASTY MEALS ON A LIMITED BUDGET, OFFERING PRACTICAL, HANDS-ON INSTRUCTION FOR ECONOMICALLY VULNERABLE INDIVIDUALS AND FAMILIES SUCH AS MEAL PREPARATION, GROCERY SHOPPING, FOOD BUDGETING THAT EMPOWERS PARTICIPANTS TO MAKE HEALTHIER CHOICES, EVEN WITH VERY LIMITED RESOURCES. COOKING MATTERS HELPS OPEN HAND ADDRESS THE CO-OCCURRING ISSUES OF FOOD INSECURITY, OBESITY, AND RELATED NUTRITION-SENSITIVE DISEASE CONDITIONS, WHICH ARE OFTEN MORE COMMON AMONG AT-RISK, DISADVANTAGED CLIENT GROUPS.

ProgSrvcAccomActy2Grp.Desc: GOOD MEASURE MEALS (GMM), OPEN HAND'S FEE-FOR-SERVICE SOCIAL ENTERPRISE, OFFERS NUTRITIOUS, HIGH QUALITY MEAL PLANS TO PEOPLE WHO WISH TO MANAGE CHRONIC ILLNESSES SUCH AS DIABETES, HYPERTENSION OR OBESITY, AND PEOPLE TRYING TO IMPROVE OR MAINTAIN A HEALTHY LIFESTYLE THROUGH BETTER NUTRITION. THIS PROGRAM EXTENDS OPEN HAND'S MISSION ACROSS THE FULL SOCIO-ECONOMIC SPECTRUM, MAKING AN EVEN GREATER IMPACT ON OUR COMMUNITY. IN 2022, OPEN HAND'S GMM SERVED 703 CLIENTS A TOTAL OF 70,154 HEALTHY MEALS THROUGH THIS PROGRAM. GOOD MEASURE MEALS ALSO PROVIDES CORPORATE WELLNESS TO CUSTOMERS ACROSS ATLANTA - IN 2022, THE RDNS PROVIDED 22 NUTRITION PROGRAMS AND 36 NUTRITION CONSULTATIONS EXPANDING VIRTUAL NUTRITION CARE TO THESE CUSTOMERS.

ProgSrvcAccomActy3Grp.Desc: IN 2022, OPEN HAND LAUNCHED A GESTATIONAL DIABETES MELLITUS (GDM) PILOT PROGRAM WHICH PROVIDED 12 WEEKS OF DIABETES-FRIENDLY MEALS AND VIRTUAL NUTRITION EDUCATION TO PREGNANT WOMEN RECENTLY DIAGNOSED WITH GDM. PARTICIPANTS WERE ALSO PROVIDED SUPPORT BY HAVING ACCESS TO AN OPEN HAND RDN AND OTHER WOMEN EXPERIENCING GDM. THIS RESEARCH PILOT PROGRAM WILL CONTINUE THROUGH EARLY 2023 WITH HOPEFUL PUBLICATION OF THE PROGRAM RESULTS IN 2024.

ProgSrvcAccomActyOtherGrp.Desc: OPEN HAND'S SENIOR NUTRITION PROGRAM PROVIDES ONE OR TWO FRESHLY COOKED HEALTH-PROMOTING MEALS TO MEET THE DAILY NUTRITION NEEDS OF HOMEBOUND OLDER ADULT CLIENTS AND OLDER ADULTS IN CONGREGATE SETTINGS. IN 2022, OPEN HAND PREPARED AND DELIVERED APPROXIMATELY 92,051 TOTAL MEALS TO OLDER ADULT CLIENTS IN LOCAL COUNTY SENIOR CENTERS. ADDITIONALLY, OPEN HAND PROVIDED NUTRITION EDUCATION AND WELLNESS COACHING TO APPROXIMATELY 1,552 OLDER ADULTS IN GROUP SESSIONS CONDUCTED IN LOCAL SENIOR CENTERS AND OLDER ADULT HIGH-RISE COMMUNITIES THROUGHOUT FULTON COUNTY, GEORGIA. IN ADDITION TO PROVIDING NUTRITION SERVICES IN ATLANTA, GEORGIA OPEN HAND EXPANDED THIS NUTRITION PROGRAM ACROSS THE STATE OF GEORGIA THROUGH A PILOT PROGRAM CALLED GRITS - GEORGIANS RECEIVING INSIGHTFUL TELENUTRITION SEMINARS. THE OPEN HAND RDNS PROVIDE NUTRITION EDUCATION ON A VIRTUAL PLATFORM TO OLDER ADULTS ATTENDING THEIR LOCAL SENIOR CENTERS, PLACES OF WORSHIP, OR IN THE COMFORT OF THEIR HOMES. IN 2022, WE PROVIDED THIS SERVICE TO 2,337 OLDER ADULTS FOR GROUP NUTRITION EDUCATION AND 83 OLDER ADULTS FOR MEDICAL NUTRITION THERAPY.

OtherAssetsOrgGrp.Desc: BENEFICIAL INTEREST IN ASSETS HELD AT COMMUNITY FOUNDATION

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: UNDER SECTION 501(C)(3) OF THE INTERNAL REVENUE CODE, THE ORGANIZATION IS EXEMPT FROM TAXES ON INCOME OTHER THAN UNRELATED BUSINESS INCOME. THE ORGANIZATION UTILIZES THE ACCOUNTING REQUIREMENTS ASSOCIATED WITH UNCERTAINTY IN INCOME TAXES USING THE PROVISIONS OF FINANCIAL ACCOUNTING STANDARDS BOARD (FASB) ASC 740, INCOME TAXES. USING THAT GUIDANCE, TAX POSITIONS INITIALLY NEED TO BE RECOGNIZED IN THE FINANCIAL STATEMENTS WHEN IT IS MORE LIKELY THAN NOT THE POSITIONS WILL BE SUSTAINED UPON EXAMINATION BY THE TAX AUTHORITIES. IT ALSO PROVIDES GUIDANCE FOR DERECOGNITION, CLASSIFICATION, INTEREST AND PENALTIES, ACCOUNTING IN INTERIM PERIODS, DISCLOSURE AND TRANSITION. AS OF DECEMBER 31, 2022 AND 2021, THE ORGANIZATION HAS NO UNCERTAIN TAX PROVISIONS THAT QUALIFY FOR RECOGNITION OR DISCLOSURE IN THE FINANCIAL STATEMENTS.
LOSS ON ASSETS HELD AT COMMUNITY FOUNDATION -171,668. SPECIAL EVENT EXPENSE 203,188.
SPECIAL EVENT EXPENSE 203,188. SALES OF ASSETS -1,300.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART III, LINE 4E, ALL OTHER ACCOMPLISHMENTS:
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: IN 2022, OPEN HAND EXTENDED THE REACH OF OUR COMPREHENSIVE NUTRITION PROGRAMMING BY ACHIEVING SEVERAL KEY GOALS: A. OPEN HAND AND GOOD MEASURE MEALS SERVED A COMBINED TOTAL OF APPROXIMATELY 10,997 CLIENTS IN 2022. THIS INCLUDES MORE THAN 1,457,520 HOME-DELIVERED MEALS, MEALS PROVIDED IN A CONGREGATE SETTING, AS WELL AS EMERGENCY MEALS AND SUPPLEMENTS. IN 2022, OUR REGISTERED DIETITIAN NUTRITIONIST (RDNS) WORKED WITH 4,639 CLIENTS, PROVIDING EXTENSIVE NUTRITION EDUCATION INCLUDING CHRONIC DISEASE AND DIABETES SELF-MANAGEMENT, COURSES OFFERED THROUGH OUR COOKING MATTERS PROGRAM, AND CONDUCTING VIRTUAL AND IN-CLINIC MEDICAL NUTRITION THERAPY (MNT, NUTRITION COUNSELING PRESCRIBED BY A PHYSICIAN). B. THE FOLLOWING PROGRAMMATIC MILESTONES WERE ACHIEVED IN 2022: 1. MEDICALLY TAILORED MEALS PROGRAM HELPING OUR CLIENTS BETTER MANAGE THEIR CHRONIC DISEASE BY PROVIDING MEDICALLY TAILORED MEALS IS ALWAYS A PRIMARY FOCUS FOR OPEN HAND. IN 2022, APPROXIMATELY 51% OF OUR CLIENTS REPORTED SPENDING FEWER DAYS IN THE HOSPITAL, 60% REPORTED IMPROVEMENT IN AT LEAST ONE HEALTH INDICATOR AND 24% REPORTED THEY ARE MORE EASILY ABLE TO TAKE THEIR MEDICATIONS AS A RESULT OF RECEIVING HEALTHY, NUTRITIOUS PREPARED MEALS. OUR ANNUAL CLIENT SURVEY FOCUSED ON MEASURING THE IMPACT OF OUR SERVICES. OF THE CLIENTS WHO RESPONDED THAT HAD A CHRONIC CONDITION, 37% REPORTED THEY SAW AN IMPROVEMENT IN THEIR CHOLESTEROL LEVELS, 40% SAW AN IMPROVEMENT IN BLOOD PRESSURE, AND 37% SAW AN IMPROVEMENT IN BLOOD SUGAR LEVELS. IN ORDER TO REACH ADDITIONAL CLIENTS, OPEN HAND MADE SIGNIFICANT INVESTMENTS TO UPDATE OPERATIONAL PROCESSES TO FREEZE AND SHIP MEALS PROVIDING ACCESS TO MEDICALLY FRAGILE INDIVIDUALS ACROSS THE STATE. 2. AS A COMPONENT OF OUR MEDICALLY TAILORED MEALS PROGRAM, OUR HOME-DELIVERED MEAL CLIENTS HAVE ACCESS TO OPEN HAND RDNS TO CONSULT WITH THEM ABOUT THEIR NUTRITION AND HEALTH AS IT RELATES TO THEIR CHRONIC DISEASE. AMONG THOSE THAT HAD SEEN AN OPEN HAND RDN IN 2022, 85% REPORTED A CHANGE IN THEIR NUTRITION-RELATED HABITS SUCH AS SHOPPING FOR HEALTHIER FOODS WHILE GROCERY SHOPPING, LEARNING HOW TO PREPARE HEALTHY MEALS ON THEIR OWN, OR LEARNING HOW TO READ NUTRITION FACTS AND INGREDIENT LABELS. 3. MARKET BASKET PROGRAM - DESIGNED BY OPEN HAND RDNS, THE MARKET BASKET PROGRAM IS AN INNOVATIVE SOLUTION TO REDUCE FOOD INSECURITY, INCREASE INTAKE OF HEALTHY FOODS, AND INCREASE NUTRITION KNOWLEDGE IN HIGH-RISK ADULTS IN METRO ATLANTA. OPEN HAND VOLUNTEERS DELIVER PROGRAM PARTICIPANTS WEEKLY MARKET BASKETS WHICH INCLUDE SEASONAL FRESH FRUIT AND VEGETABLES AND NON-PERISHABLE ITEMS, ALONG WITH NUTRITION EDUCATION MATERIALS AND RECIPES RELEVANT TO THE CONTENTS OF THAT WEEK'S BASKET TO ENCOURAGE CONSUMPTION. OPEN HAND PROVIDED 108,415 MARKET BASKET MEALS IN 2022. 4. PRODUCE PRESCRIPTION PROGRAM (PRX) - IN 2022, OPEN HAND CONDUCTED 14 COHORTS OF PRX ACROSS METRO ATLANTA AND SOUTH GEORGIA, WHICH INCLUDED COOKING MATTERS CLASSES CONDUCTED BY RDNS AND TRAINED EDUCATORS. THESE COHORTS WERE COMPRISED OF 96 TOTAL PARTICIPANTS AS A BASELINE AND MAINTAINED A 60% PARTICIPANT RETENTION RATE OVER THE COURSE OF 6-MONTHS. THE PROGRAM CONCURRENTLY PROVIDED WEEKLY PRODUCE BOX DISTRIBUTION DURING THE SIX WEEKS OF CLASSES AND CONTINUED FOR 18 WEEKS AFTER THE CONCLUSION OF CLASSES. THE PROGRAM GREW IN SOUTH GEORGIA TO REACH MORE PARTICIPANTS, INCLUDING SPANISH-SPEAKING COMMUNITIES. OPEN HAND ALSO BEGAN A PRX PROGRAM FOR PEOPLE LIVING WITH HIV/AIDS WITH ADDITIONAL FUNDING FROM THE DEPARTMENT OF HIV ELIMINATION IN ATLANTA. THE EVALUATION FINDINGS SUGGEST THAT THE PRX PROGRAM SIGNIFICANTLY IMPROVED FOOD SECURITY BY OVER 5% AND ENHANCED HEALTHY EATING HABITS, INCLUDING AN INCREASE IN THE VARIETY OF FRUITS AND VEGETABLES CONSUMED ALONGSIDE A DECREASE IN CONSUMPTION OF FRIED FOODS AND SUGAR-SWEETENED BEVERAGES. WITH REGARDS TO FOOD CHOICES, CONFIDENCE WITH PROCURING AND PREPARING HEALTHY FOODS INCREASED BY OVER 10% ACROSS ALL COHORTS. LASTLY, WE HAVE OBSERVED IMPROVEMENTS IN HEALTH AND WELLBEING OVER THE 6-MONTH PROGRAM, NOTING DECREASES IN PARTICIPANTS' BODY MASS INDEX (BMI) AND SYSTOLIC BLOOD PRESSURE LEVELS FROM A BASELINE TO MIDLINE THRESHOLD, WHICH WERE SUSTAINED THROUGH THE END OF THE 6-MONTH PROGRAM. 5. IN 2022, OPEN HAND ATLANTA CONTINUED WORKING ON A VIRTUAL NUTRITION EDUCATION PROGRAM IN RURAL GEORGIA. THIS PROGRAM, CALLED GEORGIANS RECEIVING INSIGHTFUL NUTRITION TELENUTRITION SEMINARS (OR GRITS) INCLUDES TWO TYPES OF NUTRITION EDUCATION FOR OLDER ADULTS INVOLVED IN THEIR AREA AGENCY ON AGING. THE FIRST IS VIRTUAL INDIVIDUALIZED NUTRITION COACHING FOR OLDER ADULTS WHO ARE AT A HIGH LEVEL OF NUTRITION RISK. THESE OLDER ADULTS ARE ELIGIBLE TO TALK TO A RDN WHO PROVIDES MNT TO ASSIST WITH THEIR CHRONIC CONDITIONS, FOOD SECURITY, AND/OR SHOPPING ON A BUDGET. THE SECOND PART OF THIS PROGRAM IS PROVIDING GROUP NUTRITION EDUCATION TO OLDER ADULTS AT THEIR LOCAL SENIOR CENTERS. EACH GEORGIA SENIOR CENTER IS REQUIRED TO PROVIDE AT LEAST 15 MINUTES OF NUTRITION EDUCATION TO THEIR OLDER ADULT CLIENTS EACH MONTH, AND THIS PROGRAM ALLOWS PROVIDERS TO UTILIZE OPEN HAND RDNS TO FULFILL THEIR REQUIREMENT. OPEN HAND'S NUTRITION EDUCATION PROVIDES 30-45 MINUTES OF ENGAGING NUTRITION DISCUSSION AROUND PREPARING MEALS ON A BUDGET, SLEEP AND NUTRITION, DIABETES MANAGEMENT, AND MANY OTHER TOPICS. THE RDNS PROVIDE THESE LESSONS THROUGH THE VIRTUAL PLATFORM ZOOM AND THEY PROVIDE PRE AND POST LESSON SURVEYS TO TEST KNOWLEDGE GAINED AND LIKEABILITY OF THE ZOOM LESSON. 6. FOLLOWING THE SUCCESS OF THE POST-DISCHARGE MEAL PROGRAM IN 2021 AND RECOGNIZING THAT NUTRITION IS CRITICAL FOR PATIENTS RECOVERING FROM HOSPITALIZATION, OPEN HAND ATLANTA EXPANDED THE PROGRAM TO LOCAL HEALTH SYSTEMS AND THE KAISER PERMANENTE HEALTH CARE ORGANIZATION IN 2022. THROUGH THIS PROGRAM, CLIENTS RECEIVE 21 MEALS DELIVERED TO THEIR HOME FOLLOWING HOSPITALIZATION. PARTICIPANTS WERE ALSO SCREENED FOR NUTRITION RISK FOLLOWING THEIR HOSPITALIZATION AND FOR THOSE WHO SCREENED HIGH ON THEIR NUTRITION RISK LEVEL, THEY WERE REFERRED TO AN OPEN HAND RDN FOR MEDICAL NUTRITION THERAPY. 7. GRAB & GO PRODUCTS - IN 2022, GOOD MEASURE MEALS PARTNERED WITH GRADY HOSPITAL TO STAFF AND PROVIDE GRAB AND GO PRODUCTS FOR THE JESSE HILL MARKET LOCATED ON GRADY'S DOWNTOWN CAMPUS. THE ADDITION OF THE MARKET INCREASED ACCESS TO HEALTHY, AFFORDABLE FOOD AND NUTRITION EDUCATION AMONG GRADY PATIENTS AND STAFF, AS WELL AS THE SURROUNDING COMMUNITY. ADDITIONALLY, OFFERING NUTRITIOUS, AFFORDABLE FOOD TO A WIDER POPULATION ALSO SERVES TO BENEFIT HEALTHY LIFESTYLES WITHIN THE COMMUNITY. 8. FOOD AS MEDICINE COALITION AS A CHARTER MEMBER OF THE NATIONAL FOOD IS MEDICINE COALITION (FIMC), OPEN HAND CONTINUES TO ADVOCATE WITH OUR FELLOW MEMBERS ACROSS THE COUNTRY FOR FEDERAL FUNDING STREAMS THAT SUPPORT HOME-DELIVERED, MEDICALLY-TAILORED MEALS AND NUTRITION EDUCATION PROGRAMMING. OPEN HAND CONTINUES TO BE PART OF THE ELITE GROUP OF COMMUNITY-BASED ORGANIZATIONS ACCREDITED BY FIMC FOR MEETING OR EXCEEDING THE RIGOROUS STANDARDS ESTABLISHED BY THE COALITION. THOSE STANDARDS INCLUDE MEETING SPECIFIC MEDICALLY APPROPRIATE NUTRITION TARGETS FOR ALL MADE FROM SCRATCH MEALS, STRICT QUALITY CONTROL MEASURES, THE OFFERING OF MENUS DESIGNED BY LICENSED RDNS TO MEET A VARIETY OF SERIOUS CHRONIC HEALTH CONDITIONS, AND THE PROVISION OF MEDICAL NUTRITION THERAPY (MNT) ADMINISTERED BY OUR RDNS. ADDITIONALLY, FIMC WAS REPRESENTED ON THE NATIONAL STAGE AT THE WHITE HOUSE CONFERENCE ON HUNGER, NUTRITION, AND HEALTH WHICH SHOWCASED COLLECTIVE RESEARCH ON MEDICALLY TAILORED MEALS AND MEDICAL NUTRITION THERAPY PROGRAMS PROVIDED BY FIMC AGENCIES ACROSS THE COUNTRY.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART III, LINE 4E, ALL OTHER ACCOMPLISHMENTS - CONTINUES
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: C. OPERATIONS, TECHNOLOGY AND CAPITAL CAMPAIGN 1. IMPLEMENTED A NEW YIELD TRACKING COMPUTER INTERFACE PROGRAM ALLOWING OPERATIONS STAFF (PREWEIGH AND CULINARY) TO UPDATE PRODUCTION STATUS IN REAL TIME USING TABLETS AND TOUCHSCREENS, ELIMINATING SEVERAL MANUALLY GENERATED PAPER REPORTS. 2. MIGRATED CLIENT MANAGEMENT AND ORDER PORTAL TO A NEW, MODERN VIRTUAL MACHINE (VM) IN THE MICROSOFT CLOUD SERVICES PLATFORM KNOWN AS AZURE. 3. LAUNCHED NEW EGIFT CARD FUNCTIONALITY OFFERING GOOD MEASURE MEALS CUSTOMERS THE ABILITY TO ORDER GMM GIFT CARDS FOR FRIENDS AND FAMILY. 4. LAUNCHED A FAMILY STYLE MEAL OFFERING ALLOWING GOOD MEASURE MEALS CUSTOMERS THE ABILITY TO ORDER SHAREABLE PORTION SIZES OF SOME OF OUR MOST POPULAR MEAL COMPONENTS. 5. DEPLOYED A TOTAL OF 12 HEALTHY VENDING AUTOMATED COOLERS AT GEORGIA STATE UNIVERSITY (GSU) AND GEORGIA TECH COLLEGE LOCATIONS TO PROVIDE STUDENTS AND FACULTY WITH HEALTHY LUNCH AND SNACK OPTIONS ON CAMPUS. 6. IMPLEMENTED A NEW MEAL INVENTORY COMPUTER INTERFACE PROGRAM FOR IMPROVING THE RELIABILITY AND EFFICIENCY OF THE INVENTORY MANAGEMENT OF THE THOUSANDS OF MEALS IN INVENTORY STORAGE PENDING RELEASE FOR DELIVERY. 7. LAUNCH OF $19.5 MILLION CAPITAL CAMPAIGN - THE HEALING POWER OF FOOD OPEN HAND HAS LONG STRETCHED ITS ORGANIZATIONAL CAPACITY TO MEET THE EVER-GROWING NEED TO SUPPORT AT-RISK CLIENT GROUPS. THE CONSTRAINTS IN OUR CURRENT LOCATION, WHICH WERE EXACERBATED BY THE COVID-19 PANDEMIC, ENCOURAGED US TO REEXAMINE HOW AND WHERE WE SERVE OUR CLIENTS. AFTER AN EXTENSIVE PROPERTY SEARCH, PURCHASE OF AN EXISTING 43,500 SQUARE FOOT FACILITY IN DECEMBER 2021, AND THE COMPLETION OF A CAMPAIGN FEASIBILITY STUDY CONDUCTED BY COXE CURRY AND ASSOCIATES IN APRIL 2022, OPEN HAND LAUNCHED THE HEALING POWER OF FOOD, A $19.5 MILLION COMPREHENSIVE CAPITAL FUNDRAISING CAMPAIGN. THIS CAMPAIGN WILL FUND OPEN HAND'S RELOCATION TO THE WESTSIDE OF ATLANTA AND SUPPORT THE NECESSARY BUILDING RENOVATIONS AT THE NEW SITE TO BECOME THE MAIN CAMPUS FACILITY FOR OUR GROWING BUSINESS OPERATION. ADDITIONALLY, THIS CAMPAIGN WILL CREATE A BUILDING MAINTENANCE FUND TO EFFECTIVELY POSITION US TO ADDRESS OUR FUTURE NEEDS, AND INITIATE A NEW PROGRAMMATIC EFFORT FOCUSED ON WORKFORCE DEVELOPMENT TO SUPPORT EXISTING JOB SKILLS TRAINING NEEDS PREVALENT IN THE COMMUNITY. AFTER THE PURCHASE OF THE FACILITY IN 2021, THE TENANT LEASED BACK THE PROPERTY FROM OPEN HAND FOR 18 MONTHS TO GIVE US TIME TO SELECT A CONSTRUCTION COMPANY AND PLAN THE BUILDING RENOVATION PROJECT. WE NOW HAVE FULL OWNERSHIP AND ACCESS TO THE BUILDING AT 1380 W. MARIETTA STREET, ATLANTA, GEORGIA AND IT IS UNDER ACTIVE RENOVATION. OPEN HAND PLANS TO MOVE INTO THE NEWLY RENOVATED FACILITY IN THE SECOND QUARTER OF 2024.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 11B
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: A REVIEW WILL BE CONDUCTED BEFORE FORM 990 IS FINALIZED.
